added to the whitelist
so next we've got integrity monitoring

the IPS firewall simple techniques that

what happens next is that the unknown

so there's a couple of reasons why we do

fluff at the first layer with simple
techniques we're allowing again the more
sophisticated engines to focus on what
they should be focusing on so the
unknown data we don't want to throw
everything at machine learning yes

by taking this approach reducing the

virtual patches a way to protect your

a very easy to deploy so you can either
jump in and ticket for individual
systems or for policies of groups of

of deploying the patches and we do that
through what's called a recommendation
skin so the recommendation scan will run
on a schedule usually once a week once a
fortnight once a month usually in
conjunction with whatever your main
operating system patch cycle is so if
it's Windows we're looking at Patch
Tuesday a patch Wednesday for us so what
the recommendation scan will do it was
go through and scan each of your systems
it will determine what operating systems
installed what roles what applications
are installed if it sees any gaps so if
for example Windows is two months behind
in patching you might have an Apache
server that's six months behind in
patching it can automatically apply a
virtual patch until you get around to
applying the patch so it's a great
automated way of dealing with patches
mitigating the need to go and patch
immediately as soon as new software's
